title: Understanding Ksp
text: The solubility product constant (Ksp) is an equilibrium constant that applies to the dissolution of a sparingly soluble compound. It represents the product of the concentrations of the ions each raised to the power of their coefficients in the balanced equation.

title: Write the Dissolution Equation
text: Write the balanced chemical equation for the dissolution of Ag2CO3 in water. Remember that Ag2CO3 dissociates into 2Ag+ and CO3 2-.

title: Express Ksp in Terms of Ion Concentrations
text: For the dissolution of Ag2CO3, express the Ksp in terms of the concentrations of Ag+ and CO3 2-. Use the equation: Ksp=(Ag+)**2*(CO3 2-).

title: Relate Ion Concentrations to Solubility
text: Let the molar solubility of Ag2CO3 be 's'. Then, the concentration of Ag+ will be 2s and the concentration of CO3 2- will be s. Substitute these into the Ksp expression.

title: Solve for Molar Solubility
text: Substitute the expressions for ion concentrations into the Ksp equation: $$Ksp=\left(2s\right)^2 s$$. Solve for 's' given $$Ksp=8.1e-12$$.
